Bey Herrn Haag dem Buchbinder in der Augustiner-Gac sind zu verkauffen: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ludwig Gottfrieds</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Beschreibung von Schweden</TITLE>, mit viel schnen Kupferen, <PLACE>Franckfurt</PLACE> <YEAR>1632</YEAR>. <FORMAT>fol</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Rollin</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Histoire Romaine</TITLE> <VOLUME>IT. Tomes</VOLUME>,<PLACE>Amsterd.</PLACE> <YEAR>1744</YEAR>. <FORMAT>8v6</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lightfooti</AUTHOR> <TITLE>hori Hebr. in 4. Critica Ling. Lat.</TITLE> <PLACE>Lipf.</PLACE> <YEAR>1729</YEAR>. <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Clericus</AUTHOR> <TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE> <PLACE>Tubing.</PLACE> <YEAR>1733</YEAR>. <VOLUME>11. Tomi</VOLUME> <FORMAT>fol</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Ein Frantzsischer Atlas</TITLE> von <VOLUME>50. Carten</VOLUME></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":4,"explanation":"1. The <TITLE> tag for the Clericus entry was malformed: <TITLE=in Pentateuch...> was changed to <TITLE>in Pentateuch...<\/TITLE>.
2. The ampersand (&) in 'in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.' was escaped as &.
3. The unicode escape sequences such as \u221a\u00fc, \u221a\u2202, \u221a\u00a7, \u221a\u2264, \u221a\u2202, and \u221a\u00a7 were replaced with their best matching character or left as is if uncertain, since these appear to be encoding errors or artifacts; for example, Jen\u221a\u00a7 to Jen\u0077 (w), 4t\u221a\u2264 to 4t\u001e4, and so on. Some are left as is due to ambiguity.
4. Ensured all <BIBL> entries are properly closed and nested."}

2. The ampersand (&) in 'in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.' was escaped as &.
3. The unicode escape sequences such as \u221a\u00fc, \u221a\u2202, \u221a\u00a7, \u221a\u2264, \u221a\u2202, and \u221a\u00a7 were replaced with their best matching character or left as is if uncertain, since these appear to be encoding errors or artifacts; for example, Jen\u221a\u00a7 to Jen\u0077 (w), 4t\u221a\u2264 to 4t\u001e4, and so on. Some are left as is due to ambiguity.
4. Ensured all <BIBL> entries are properly closed and nested.
